website_summaries.verdict: A good choice when it comes to style and construction, although the bracket curve is a disappointment for some.
pros: A hefty rod that is also pretty
antique bronze accent complements the finish of the rod
Looks nice with various curtains styles and colors
cons: Bracket curve makes it difficult to tighten top screw
Mounting hardware looks a bit cheap
it doesn't complement the appearance of the rod

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to screw mount into wall.
customer_reviews.text: The design of the wall mounts blocks a screwdriver from actually accessing the top screw. It is literally impossible to screw in the top screw to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Holroyd

customer_reviews.title: Tightening the top screw tool
customer_reviews.text: I've read the reviews and thank you for pointing out the design problem with the top screw. It's a real bear to tighten especially when you're close to the cealling. I found s ratchet screw driver Maxcraft 60601 flex ratchet screwdriver. $10.91. I didn't have a lot of clearance tightening the top screw but using this tool made it possible and it wasn't difficult. You have to supply the Philips bits but as I have collected several over the years I was all set I specifically got this tool for this job because I read your reviews thanks
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: There is no design flaw, you're just not tooled up.
customer_reviews.text: You literally just need the correct tools and proper skill set to install this. Don't flame the product because you're not handy. If you can't do it, hire someone to do it. You need a long enough screwdriver if you don't have an impact driver with an extension. You also need a drill if you're going to use the anchors (so you should have an impact driver). I was able to bite into the stud and didn't need to the anchors. Actual review The pole is sturdy, it comes with everything you need, it comes with the brackets to hang it, there is no design flaw, it's not expensive, and it was delivered quickly. What is there to complain about?
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Nice but deceptively hard to install
customer_reviews.text: Hardware provided is impossible install with standard tools. I had to purchase box screws so I could get a box wrench behind the bracket, as the bracket shape blocks the use of a screwdriver. Other than that, the rod are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Not white, think: buttermilk, or smoker-stained white
customer_reviews.text: Beme must have grown up with just the 6-crayon set because this is NOT WHITE. This is ivory or a very muddled brownish/yellowing off-white. I know they're going for the antiqued look with the old victorian stylings but if your house trim started taking on the appearance of rancid milk you either had a father who smoked or, like Beme, was simply trying to avoid proper paint. By the way, this applies to their other "white" product lines. Won't be buying Beme again.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived chipped and broken. I’m keeping it because it won’t show where I’m using it. This is really cheap material and was shipped in a giant box with no packing or support. Pick something else. Edit: upon closer inspection the rod cannot even be used. The end of one diff is collapsed and the finial is so dilapidated that I can’t even put it in my house. Amazon will use 12 dollars of packing bubbles for cotton balls, but nothing on breakables.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Would never buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: This is so pretty but the design is horrible. You cannot mount it right. They put the screw at the top of a curve and I tried so many different size screw drivers and extensions and had a terrible time getting the screw even half way tight. It's in there but not sure if it will hold. I wouldn't order this again at all. I bought two so with second one my husband ended up buying some other brackets and mounting it with those instead.
customer_reviews.author: KimmyC

customer_reviews.title: Easiest to hang!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these drapery rods to date. They are the easiest to put up of any of the rods of this type and price point that I’ve put up over the years and I’ve put up many. The parts are more substantial and the hooks are constructed in a way that actually allows a screwdriver clear access to the screws that attach to the wall, an essential part of hanging a drapery rod! And the next time I need a rod I will buy my 4th.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Nichols

customer_reviews.title: I love the style of the rod
customer_reviews.text: I love the style of the rod, but the brackets are very poorly designed and almost impossible to install. I am currently searching for brackets to replace the ones that come with the rod. Would not reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Jane W

customer_reviews.title: Simple but hardware jets out from wall a lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a very wide set of windows in my living room and didn’t want to spend a lot for an extra long rod. It goes up without a problem. It’s light weight. It’s a nice basic rod. Once up its looks good. The only issue I have is that the hardware sticks out far from the wall. This creates a big gap where light shines through. I didn’t purchase it for room darkening curtains but the gap just looks odd.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Darling

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install with Minimum Expertise
customer_reviews.text: Install complaints? No idea why. But 1st, it looks fantastic. If it's difficult for you to screw other than straight forward this not for you. But if you have minimal skill and can screw from a slightly downward or sideways angle you'll finish putting in the top screw in under 60 sec. Note: would not recommend using power tool to do this. Good old fashioned Phillips head screwdriver does the trick. That's why it takes about a minute. Doing it by hand rather than power tool is "the secret."
customer_reviews.author: Piaf fan

customer_reviews.title: Not Hard to Install, Very Sturdy, Nice Design
customer_reviews.text: Excuse the mess in the room. I'm still rearranging this office. The curtain rod is sturdy, arrived 1 day early and was very easy to put up. I used a drill and would say that you really should use a level when putting up the holders. People say it's hard to put the holders up, but I find that to be the case with every curtain rod I've ever done. I used a drill with a long bit and it worked better than all the other ones I've put up. I still need to iron the curtains, but it looks great together. I plan on putting up a light gray paint on the walls or a medium blue.
customer_reviews.author: Some Person

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the issues with the screw hole placement, but I had no problem at all attaching these to the wall with a normal screwdriver. Happy to see they provided wall anchors. Looks good, securely holds blackout curtains - I'll probably get a couple more for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: L. H. Christenson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this on Amazon without looking at it in person but I am super happy with my choice. This bar comes with three pieces and it is sturdy with the middle bar I am pleased I didn’t have to use the middle support and my one piece curtain is heavy duty. The person(s) who had issues installing the brackets just needed a longer phillips or like I used a longer drill bit. Use proper tools. Super easy. I used the wall anchors which entailed pre-drilling the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Lanny

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: These are very pretty; color is right. Sturdy. I was concerned about them sagging if they were extended all the way out, but they're working great; it's important that the 72" has the center bracket for the added support needed. I only put the 4 *s for installation in consideration of less-avid tool-users. There were many reviews that complained about the shape of the brackets making installation difficult; but I was amused by the one guy who posted a review and a video holding his phone while installing. My husband has plenty of construction experience, but it can still be done easily by anybody with preparation and the right tools. Just pre-drill your holes angled like that other guy said.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding look and a quality far superior to the curtain rods I had previously from a local department store. Installation was quick (only about 15 minutes) and very simple. For anyone reading other reviews about the design issue on the wall mounts... It certainly could have been designed better but it is not a major issue if you simply screw in the top screw first and hold bracket with the top screw being center and the bottom at either 3 or 9 as if looking at a clock face. Once the top screw is tightened you can simply rotate the bracket to align the bottom screw at that point, much easier than trying to tighten the top screw from above.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the other reviews before buying; I'm not sure what some of the other people are talking about, but I had no problem installing these. I had actually never even used a drill before installing these rods, and I found it super easy. The instructional video is dead-on; I followed it step for step. So glad the anchors came with it; the curtains I'm using are rather heavy. And they look gorgeous on the wall! 5/5 in all areas!
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Elegant as the quality is superfluous!
customer_reviews.text: I will take a photo as soon as i pit together all my Amazon furiture..I know pictures say what words cant.moved out of state April 29.. bad luck with one home invasion,one robbery..but soon by Jan. If not Christmas I'll have it all built ..finally found a builder..These rods are so elegant..as the go beautifully with my black out curtains..i even purchased the tie backs that are with this set..Absolutely Elegant..
customer_reviews.author: Kimme Paola Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Don’t pay attention to the negative reviews about not being able to screw on right because of the angle of the hole, clearly I was able to do this with one hand while taking a picture, just added a longer Phillips extension and I was good! Item is study, make sure when you drill your hole for your drywall anchors you don’t still them too loose, I hammered mine in snug and screwed on perfect
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Our top rod pick!
customer_reviews.text: We love the look and quality of this curtain rod so much that we've purchased this make and model four times in a row, as we redecorate each of the rooms in our home! The rods look very high quality and the weight/ durability doesn't disappoint. The rod in our living room has been up for about three years and holds up a pretty heavy set of darkening curtains, above the vaulted windows, without any issues. Our rods in the playroom, sensory room, and kitchen have been up from two years to two days. They're ALL exactly what we wanted! We'll definitely be back for more!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: More value than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality and finish. I used this rod to hang a drapes over an entrance door to my sunroom. It installed easily and coordinated nicely with the drapes I chose. I wanted a simple rod with an appealing look as it is part of my family room. The cost was well below any other rods I had looked at in various stores and quality well above many of them. I recommend this rod to those who want a quality rod with great appearance at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: SC Mike

customer_reviews.title: Beatiful rod, bad design of brackets
customer_reviews.text: Love the rod! But just like all the other reviews you'll read, the top screw is completely useless unless you buy a special tool to put them in-the way they designed them is a bit off, so when you try to line the bracket hole up with the screw, either the screw will go in completely crooked or you can't insert the screw. We have our curtain rod held up with all three brackets that this set came with, and none of the three top screws are screwed in, and it's still holding our curtains up fine! We have actually bought three sets of these, and love them!
customer_reviews.author: April Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Can not span 144" as described
customer_reviews.text: Bought the size 72"-144". Item can NOT safely span 144" as described. The middle extension piece in the rod assembly is way too loose (there is about 1/8" gap when inserted into outer rod pieces), which makes the entire rod extremely unstable. Have to repair my drywall now as we drilled the wholes for the brackets that came with the set! Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Quality and great price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for 6 windows in my sunroom. They were so fantastic I ordered 5 more for all the windows in my bedroom. What is totally amazing to me is that every single curtain rod was in perfect condition and not a single screw, anchor, or knob was missing. These days it seems like you never get all the necessary pieces right? Every single one was perfect!! This company is doing a really great job in my opinion. The product itself is fantastic, no defects on any of them. Great price too, I couldn't even find white curtain rods in my local stores and these are thicker and better quality than rods nearly twice their price.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lawhead

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, but really poorly designed brackets
customer_reviews.text: Yes I’m a female. Yes I’ve torn out ceilings. Yes I’ve drilled, sawed, chopped, etc. these brackets ARE STUPID. The angle you have to be able to screw them it at is ridiculous. I don’t even know how you can make a bracket so awful. Otherwise, the brackets are sturdy, the curtain rod is solid, they look nice, etc. do not buy these expecting to be able to drill them in close to the ceiling for full length curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: it looks horrible! Sad about this buy
customer_reviews.text: This rod claims to be white but it definitely isn't, it is very off white, beige would be much more accurate. When paired with white curtains, the difference is appalling, it looks horrible! Sad about this buy, I hate to return stuff, I don't want or plan to, but it sure makes baby's room look bad.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great looking sturdy curtain rod, highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: We liked this curtain rod, to begin with it was super easy to install and it was a sturdy enough to hold our 94"curtains. We were really I am pressed with the quality considering it was less expensive to the others that you can find at HD or Lowes. This was my very first installation and it took me like 15-20 mins to finish the job. We have a 17 month old toddler and so were looking for a sturdy one to ensure the curtains hold steadily enough, and were impressed with the quality of the finish. Overall great product for the price you pay!
customer_reviews.author: Shiva

customer_reviews.title: it's not all metal and the brackets are tricky to mount
customer_reviews.text: The holes on the mounting bracket are such that you can't get a straight shot at the screws. Makes it difficult but not impossible. Chances of your screws going in straight are unlikely unless you have used anchors. It is not all metal construction as the mounting brackets are plastic as are parts of the finial. In the picture the main part is metal, the collar and the end cap are plastic. The collar will crack if you aren't careful when tightening. Overall, the strength seems to be good and it looks nice enough. If you're looking for high end, this isn't it. If you're looking for something that's decent and gets the job done, this will work.
customer_reviews.author: Janars

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good. Difficult to install the mount.
customer_reviews.text: Summary: I purchased this to used for a small home theater room with blackout curtains. The quality of the rod is good and has a nice silver color. But installing the mount is difficult because part of the mount blocks the screw hole at the top of the mount. It can be an inconvenience, especially if multiple rods are being installed.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and I'm satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to hang the pair of Nicetown 70" x 84" curtains. These curtains require this rod to hang properly due to the weight. I did not use the middle bracket for the rod. They are that strong. Glad I spent a little more and got these. Of course they can be a little cheaper but overall I'm satisfied and they look nice.
customer_reviews.author: M. McConaughey

customer_reviews.title: Installed across 10ft sliding door, sturdy, solid, beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I installed this by myself over a 10’ sliding door opening and it’s beautiful with my curtains. Better than blinds and allows me to let natural light in when using curtains. The bars are sturdy, the finials are easy to install and the extension bars are the same sturdiness as the rest of the rod, whereas some are thinner and cheaper, this one is not. Great buy, beautiful finish.
customer_reviews.author: Karie Herring

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough. Pretty standard install. There was an extra rod??? Maybe for extension? These are more like reverse telescoping, if that makes sense. Good value. They look nice. I used sturdier anchors than what was included. Which is normal with rod purchases. Also there were no instructions. I was sort of confused with the “extra” rod.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Weird Installation - Read Reviews for Tips
customer_reviews.text: The rod and wall attachments are beautiful. The other reviewers are right in stating that you can't use a drill to drill in the top screw. What people need to be doing is using a drill bit to pre-drill the holes and then install the mounting hardware. I picked up a rachet screw driver in order to install the screw at an angle. Worked perfectly. I then put up the new blackout curtains I ordered and everything looks beautiful. I'll probably order a few more of these when I move into my new house.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Depending on the length you need, it can few pretty wobbly in the middle, but so far with careful handling, we haven’t had too much of an issue. I would suggest ordering a size up instead of using the rod to its full length, this may provide extra support. All in all, we’ve bought 2 of these and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: needed some extra work
customer_reviews.text: The bar was beautiful, but the center rod holder had no holes drilled for the screws, luckily I was prepared with the proper drill bit for metal, but if I didn't have handy woman experience, I would have had to get someone to show me what I needed to finish the job. They should come so anyone can install them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod. Looks great finish matches my decor perfect
customer_reviews.text: Nice rod. Looks great finish matches my decor perfect..I have this rod on all my windows with a medium weight curtains. Easy to install u just need the right tools which I put these up with a drill and a Phillips bit....putting these up with a long handle screw driver is just not going to work and really not the proper tool when u look at its bracket...thus it’s bad reviews for an inaccessible screw....if u use proper tool it goes up in a breeze
customer_reviews.author: alina martinez

customer_reviews.title: What a beautiful rod
customer_reviews.text: Very very happy for this purchase. Decopolitan 1-Inch Urn Single Window Treatment Rod Set, 36 to 72-Inch, Antique Silver has a beautiful shade of silver, more darker than common silver looking. It looks great on the wall, great addition to my room. Bought several of them, either double rods. Really recommand this rod.
customer_reviews.author: simona

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed and finished
customer_reviews.text: Not so great: Finish was chipped off two of the three brackets and one of the ends of the finials. The bracket holes to attach the brackets to the wall are poorly designed so that you can't screw them straight into the wall because the bracket curves in the way. You have to angle your screws way up or down to anchor the brackets to the wall. Rods slip into each other without a way to stop them from sliding inside each other. Good; the rods are heavy duty and easily support heavy curtain fabric.
customer_reviews.author: White Mountain customer

customer_reviews.title: Great look and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install! Beautiful! Perfectly stretched to fit our double door opening for the dining room! Using this as a means of room dividing. Hung the curtain on it and 6mos later is still hanging up with no issues. The curtain slides along the rod without any problems. The rod stays securely in the wall brackets and doesn't bounce out when the curtain is moving. I am pleased and highly recommend this window treatment!
customer_reviews.author: twitchnln

customer_reviews.title: Awful to Install
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 of the Decopolitan rod sets. Both silver. Very pretty. However - after reading the reviews again, it's clear that the original design was impossible to install - it was flawed in it's design. It seems that Amazon has corrected the problem. But they sent us one flawed set and one new set ----- so we ruined our walls installing the first set. The rods are up but after hours of frustration. When we got to the second set my husband realized that they had corrected the flaw. It was overall, an awful experience. Amazon should have pulled all the flawed items. It took hours of work to restore our walls. Amazon should compensate us.
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but look good
customer_reviews.text: These look good on the wall, easy to install. Only reason for not giving 5 stars was some of mine arrived broken but the return process was easy and they shipped me new ones.
customer_reviews.author: JessS

customer_reviews.title: This curtain rod is very sturdy. It came with two supports for either end
customer_reviews.text: This curtain rod is very sturdy. It came with two supports for either end, and a center support...which was perfect for the heavy black out curtains that I currently have on them. The diameter of the rod was exactly what I was looking for to go with the grommet style curtains. The color is great, and contrary to what a few other reviews have said, the decorative end caps are metal. The entire piece seems well built. I also got the matching tie-backs, which I would recommend to "finish" the look. Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: DemonChild

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, tricky brackets
customer_reviews.text: I just bought two of these and overall I'm pretty pleased with them. The quality of the finish is good and the pole is nice and strong. I only needed to span about 80" but used the center bracket too for added strength. As other reviewers have pointed out the bracket design is the worst aspect. Getting the top screw in is very tricky. I tried a variety of screwdrivers before finding one that has a long slender blade. Hex adapters etc are all too big to get in there. Unless you have a good selection of tools to get this up I'd look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Britincali

customer_reviews.title: Great rods, great color, strong n sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Great rod. Nice finish, and look. Installed in a breeze. All the complaints about 'cannot reach screw', really don't think in a problem solving manner. When I was installing it, it didn't even occur to me to complain about the screw hole placement, because I had zero trouble getting at it and screwing it in tightly. I guess YMMV. Great rod otherwise. Sturdy for the blackout panels I put on it (4 of them). I did use the center hanger.
customer_reviews.author: IncredibleHat

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but had one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: This curtain rod looks very nice and seems high quality, but installation was a pain because the top screw holes are slightly blocked by the arch of the bracket, so you cannot get a straight shot with a screwdriver or drill. (See picture.) As you can imagine, screwing at an angle is a easy way to strip a screw head...
customer_reviews.author: R. Smalley

customer_reviews.title: Do not order this. It's flimsy, not advertised length and shotty material
customer_reviews.text: This is not the advertised length and it is flimsy as well as the end knobs are mismatched materials. They expect me to mail it back for a refund. $36 for this! It's not even worth 8. I'm simply going to contact my credit card company and informed them that I'm not paying for this item. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Rea

customer_reviews.text: As described, does the trick. We have this above our sliding doors along with a curtain we purchased. If I could change anything at all, it wold be the way the screw holes are. It is hard to screw the screws all the way in without hitting and possibly damaging the rest of the assembly because of the angle.
customer_reviews.author: Vita Haus

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: A Nice curtain rod. Its solid, sturdy, and looks great. The bronze highlights on finials are not as pronounced as picture which was kind of disappointing, but it still looks good. I bought a small ratchet screwdriver to deal with the top screw being blocked by bracket, per some other reviews, but did not need it at all. It you simply start top screw at a slight angle, it naturally nests into position, and I had not trouble screwing it all the way into wall with a regular phillips screwdriver. Some peeps need to go back to DIY school, lol.
customer_reviews.author: G.D. Klinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Look and price
customer_reviews.text: We received the product with broken ends. I contacted the vendor and they immediately sent me out replacements. The vendor was very responsive. I appreciated the vendor making the product whole because it would have been a headache to pack up everything up and send it back. Overall, the rod is as advertised. It was easy to install and looks nice with the curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Chill

customer_reviews.title: No problem installing brackets...
customer_reviews.text: I did not run into the problems that others had installing the brackets. As long as you screw in the top first, I was able to use a regular ol' screw driver and it screwed flush with the bracket (I did use heavier dry wall anchors though, the small ones that come with the package are pretty cheap). The pole is pretty solid and the end caps look nice, so I only knocked a star off for the plastic/resin brackets. They seem pretty solid, but I would have preferred metal. Still a great product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Not 144”
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a 144” installation and if your thinking about it for the same get something else the safest length they extend to is about 136” I FOUGHT with them the entire time what a nightmare and they are not heavy duty at all guess u get what u pay for.
customer_reviews.author: gonga

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: It looks cheap compared to our other curtain rods from Country Curtains. I am not impressed, but it does the job for the price. Fortunately there is less light in the room where it is installed. You can’t see the imperfections on the end pieces. Also the pole scratches easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice curtain rod
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice curtain rod. It comes in 2 pieces. There is a telescopic rod (for, I think, 72-100" windows) that then has a 3rd attachment in case you have an extra long window (100"+). I used it for an 86" window (so I did not need the additional piece). I already had nice brackets installed on the ends, but I did install the center piece for extra support (with 4 sheer panels, it did bow slightly in the middle) and I did not have the other problem that others reported with getting it to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Run away
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product a year ago and while it earned three in durability since it easily scuffs it is awful to install and uninstall. The tools provided won’t work and traditional tools won’t work since the screw holes are blocked by the poor design. You will NOT be able to bolt this on without working miracles and after it’s all said and done the work will cause more stains and unwanted damage. Run away from this product... mines in the dumpster while I look and find new curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Murillo Cuellar

customer_reviews.title: Horrible description.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a decent product but I'm going to be returning it and I'm not going to tell you exactly why. I'm just going to continue to let this product be returned by multiple buyers. My suggestion to seller is to spend a little time in the description actually explaining the item instead of telling us how great it is or maybe even a few pictures that actually shows the pieces of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design hard to install
customer_reviews.text: Poor design hard to install, Website does not explain how far its from wall. And its total more than 5 inches. Packaging was cheap doe snot indicate who the manufacturs/company is. Should not have bought it Check  that seems better
customer_reviews.author: SandyAtl

customer_reviews.title: Well made rod
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping to get this up today. It is a beautiful rod and very well made. I was impressed by how well it was packaged for shipping, protected and boxed very well. I would recommend to any person needing a curtain rod.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Swearing for an hour.
customer_reviews.text: As many have warned here, this is almost impossible to screw in the top screw with common household tools (EX: drill, screwdriver). Having seen this close up it isn't amazing in any regard and not worth the hassle. I cannot fathom someone could fail designing this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: Decent value for the appearance of quality (which is mostly backed by the feel of the components)
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product and value though the antiquing is harder to notice than the photo even in a bright room and the rod is a little less stout than I'd expect, though not bad. The mounts and decorative ends feel substantial and, by contrast, make the rod seem mismatched in quality though for the price doesn't feel unreasonable. If you're using these with blackout curtains, note that the supports put the rod out from a wall further than some which is aesthetically pleasing but will leave a notable gap for light to leak through when the curtains are closed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great curtain rods.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, light weight, and look nice. I had no trouble with installation. It is a little tight at the top. I recommend using a power drill type drill/screw driver to install. It makes it easier. Predrill your holes and screw in the bottom screw first. This will cause the bracket to be more secure when you go to screw in the top screw.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: The mounting brackets are shaped such that you have no clearance to screw in the top screw and it ends up stripping out (even with the correct size phillips head) due to the offset angle. The screws are awful to begin with, even the bottom screws were stripping out a bit too. Additionally, the rod came with only one threaded hole for the end cap, so you can only attach one of the ends.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Molnar

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the style and design
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to mount above an 8' bay window. I am very pleased with the style and design. Please do NOT let the people complaining about the location of the top of screw hole deter you from buying this curtain rod. UNLESS you are mounting these brackets tight to the ceilng. The fix is to simply drill the hole for the top plug and screw on a slight down angle which allows you to clear the top of the the bracket when installing the top screw. It really isn't a big deal at all. I had everything unpacked and installed in less than 15 minutes. The price and quality make for a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hang a heavy curtain on my sliding door. As it's for a slider I wanted one that didn't need the middle support to hold the curtain without sagging. I only used 2 of the rods to span the door of about 72 inches, and it holds up the curtain with no sag at all. It also matches the motif of the hardware we're using, of an antique bronze look.
customer_reviews.author: Bob_in_NH

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job good value.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. It’s a curtain rod. So that’s not a surprise. The design and color are what had me buy it. It matches the hardware of my house. Does it’s job. Could be a bit more heavy duty, seeing as the length it can extend but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Versitile
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy curtain rod with three separate rods so you have a lot of options as far as the size of the window you want to use it on. The price was excellent compared to the quality of the item. The decorative ends are finished nicely and solid as well. There are not that many choices when it comes to finding curtain rods of this length and I'm glad I found this one.
customer_reviews.author: The Millers

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Elegant
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! I hung this in my parents' bedroom. It's sturdy and very simple to put up. For reference, the window is 47 inches wide, so this is a perfect fit. The quality is outstanding. They are really pleased. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: FlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and looks great too.
customer_reviews.text: Looked for a good rod like this for awhile, and am glad I ordered this one. Fits great over my 124" window, and no sag with 4 full length curtains on it. They sit far enough off the wall that I could still leave my bamboo blinds up behind the curtain. Would deffinetly order again.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Build quality and looks are fine but as other reviews have mentioned
customer_reviews.text: Build quality and looks are fine but as other reviews have mentioned, the mount design is horrible. Attempting to mount these to the wall is a serious hassle and it could have been easily avoided if they put more than 2 seconds of thought into these. In short, the mounts design doesn't give you easy access to the screws when attempting to screw them in. Frustrating, I wouldn't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: love it looks great in the front area of my home.
customer_reviews.text: love it looks great in my living room thinking about gettting the same ones for my sliding back door and guest room.... update 01-17-16 I have now ordered 3 of this same pole. I love how great it coordinates with my home decor. I have one on my front windows, large side window and back sliding door. They are very sturdy and simple to hang up. I will definitely look at other styles from this company for my bedroom guest room and office as well! They look exactly like the picture which is always appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: Auhbrey Kumming

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install, poor integrity
customer_reviews.text: The product looks sharp once installed, but the design is quite bad and not meant for easy installation. The curved shape makes it really hard to screw it into the wall. Also, once installed, the tube slides around no matter how hard you try to tighten it. Overall, an “ok” product if you don’t care much for having to adjust it back every now and then and if you can get the installation right
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: comes with 3 supports, needed 4, but made it work - gorgeous!
customer_reviews.text: This is so beautiful, very happy with this purchase. I got the matching pull-backs and they are a perfect match and look beautiful as well. Very sturdy. I have 4 windows that it had to stretch across , so technically, I needed 4 support pieces (approx 135" end to end), 2 on either end and 2 in-between the center windows. But since it only came with 3, we put one in-between center right and right window and we have nothing supporting the pole between the center-left and left windows. But it still holds perfectly with no bowing. I will eventually install another support piece though to prevent future bowing. If you have 4 windows - get an extra support piece.
customer_reviews.author: no_deadbeats

customer_reviews.title: Missing and defective parts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April in anticipation of my remodel project reaching completion. My floor was installed late summer and didn't have a chance to install the curtain rod until today. Unfortunately much of the item is missing including the hardware and end posts. Also one of the rod hooks is bent. So disappointing when it is too late to send back. $30 in the garbage. Lesson learned, always inspect packages immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: chances are good that you'll strip out the screw head
customer_reviews.text: + Cost - These are reasonably priced + Looks - They do not look horrid - Installation - Holy **** Batman! Whoever designed these NEVER actually used them. As others have pointed out, the top screw hole is positioned such that you cannot drive the screw in straight. God forbid you actually strike a stud - your driver is going to already be at an angle, chances are good that you'll strip out the screw head. Even 1/8 inch (preferably 1/4) offset on the top hole would have made these much easier to install. Overall, these are OK. I consider them 'budget' curtain rods. Definitely a case of 'you get what you pay for.'
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great!
customer_reviews.text: Did the job. The design looks great and it was quick and easy to install. It’s not the top of the line quality, obvious by the price. But it looks great and is sturdy! They must’ve fixed the design flaw from other reviews. It does that job and That’s all you need it for really. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Nice !
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit expensive... but they are very good quality. They stay well away from the wall too which I like for my style curtains. The top screw is a bit tricky to get in and you'll definitely want anchors it's pretty heavy. But looks great and very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, well worth the money! Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: These exceeded my expectations. I was concerned with the installation considering some of the reviews. No special tool needed, installed with an electric drill, easy breezy. Beautiful bright white,, sturdy. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: JCM

customer_reviews.title: Stressful
customer_reviews.text: Pretty rod, somewhat difficult to assemble. Definitely requires 2 people. No matter what I do it continues to separate and pop open spilling itself and my drapes on the floor every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Please Read Before You Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Problem is the Brackets. There are two screws holing each bracket onto the wall. A top screw and bottom screw. Bottom screw is easy enough. But the top screw is almost impossible to screw in. There is a design fault of the bracket. There is an arch shape of the bracket that covers the top hole, making it extremely difficult to screw the top in. I had to play around for a while, angle the screw carefully to get into the wall. I had to buy shorter screws (from Lowes), allowing the brackets to be mounted. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Neil A.

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: We just moved into a new home. I have bedroom windows that are a set of three and needed an extra long rod, needing it to be at least 125 inches long. I could not find any that long in a store. So as usual I turned to Amazon. The rod was delivered in two days, it looks exactly as pictured, very sturdy and was in perfect condition. The curtains I hung are heavy panels with black-out linings because I used it on a west facing window down here in south Texas. There is no sagging at all, the rod is ver sturdy and so easy to put up. I would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient, nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, however, I thought these were a bit expensive for the quality, brackets are poorly designed and very light-weight. The top screw is a pain to put in, however, I have a 6" Philip's driver tip, that really helped. Also, the screws are very soft so they will strip out very easily, I threw these out and used other screws.
customer_reviews.author: Gino Filippi

customer_reviews.title: Smaller cheaper looking mounting brackets
customer_reviews.text: I gave three stars on the install because I ordered two of the same rods for two windows. and they came with different hardware. It looks like the company downgraded hardware and I got one from the old style and one from the new style. The new style is smaller and more cheaply made. I have these tods in other rooms and reordered for my master bedroom. Sorry to see the cheaper brackets.
customer_reviews.author: nomad

customer_reviews.title: Works great across the top of my 54" wide window with ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Works great across the top of my 54" wide window with 2 curtain panels hanging from it. Came with all the required hardware. Definitely follow the suggestion of doing the screws by hand. I didn't have any problems with screw heads stripping but I did notice it was was easier than trying with a powered tool. One of my decorative end caps somehow came undone in the package. It was very easy to put it back together. I held one end with a tool and screwed the "lid" back on and it was secured. If you try to do it by hand only you won't be able to get it tight enough.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Not adequate support for 144"
customer_reviews.text: If you are using this rod the full 144" the 3 included supports (brackets) are not enough. The rod is in 3 pieces. If you put a bracket on either end you need 2 brackets where the rods connect. If you try to just use the one included in the center it bends where the rods connect. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Callee

customer_reviews.title: It can be extended from like 70 inches to over 100 inches.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for me 80 inch sliding glass door and is very blackout!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Dolworth

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with a drill, level, and screwdriver. Note that the brackets have top and bottom screws, and the top one is just above the arm on the bracket, which makes inserting the screws difficult. If you drill your hole at a slight downward angle it makes this a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: R. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: It installed easily. I mounted it at the top of the window frame so the frame isn't visible and the window looks larger. I had to remove one end because of the pantry is so close to the window but expected that. I'm very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra W

customer_reviews.title: Not so good for long lengths
customer_reviews.text: First, the rod is very weak metal which is not very supportive. If you need over 100" like I did then it gets even weaker. the rod holders are cheap metal and the top screw is almost impossible to get in because of the curved holder covering the screw hole. Overall I would not buy this rod again. Update: Bought this rod again.... It's the only decent looking one with a good price. This time though I only needed 80" length and it worked fine for that length.
customer_reviews.author: Billieg

customer_reviews.title: Not quite antique white
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these, especially for the price but unfortunately, I hate the color. The product description says antique white but compared to the product picture, they look beige. According to the reviews, the top screw is in a bad spot. They’d be a pain to install without the proper tools.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: No issues with installation hardware like some have stated
customer_reviews.text: Great curtain rods. I'm not sure if they updated their design, but I had no issues with the top screws on the mounting hardware like some reviews have discussed. Just use an extender on your screw gun and no troubles.
customer_reviews.author: Hist 101

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: It took me 5 mins to install the rod. It is a very sturdy and durable rod. Mines is extended almost to the end with two curtains on them. It looks really expensive but it’s not, it’s just a really great product. Great Buy
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: there is a middle hook!
customer_reviews.text: this product comes with three hooks, which makes it impossible to fully slide the hung curtains from one end to the other. we decided to make do and slide the curtains towards the CENTER in order to compensate as the third hook was deemed necessary for structural integrity.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but you need a power tool
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to install but you really need a power drill to do it right. The rods look great and it's easy to take them apart for threading them into the grommets of the curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Whatch for damaged packing or wrappings...
customer_reviews.text: This product as received march12 was totally unacceptable. In happy anticipation I opened the box and found broken end caps still in the plastic bags, and small tears in the bags. RMA has been requested and received. The replacement Set was received very quickly, 2 or 3 days after I requested it. Installation was quite easy and the Set works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby GRASP

customer_reviews.title: BAD Mounting Hardware!
customer_reviews.text: The mounting hardware that holds the rod is horrible. You have to put the screws in at an angle and you don't get a very secure mount because of the angle. If you buy this set, expect to go out and buy new mounting hardware that actually works. Would definitely not buy this product again. Find something else that works! The stars are more for the decent price and the rod.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Deva

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screws and hangers
customer_reviews.text: The rod for this is fine, however the hangers are very poorly designed. The top screw is next to impossible to install without stripping out the head because of the angle you have to access it. It also doesn't help that they are cheap screws that strip easily. I broke the first one they sent me and returned it for another which I managed to get on the wall very carefully but when I took it down to paint I had to try and put it up again. That didn't work out well and this cheap junk is now in the trash where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Simple design
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. It's a simple design easy enough to install although you have to insert the top screw at an angle because the design that holds the rod gets in the way of screwing straight.
customer_reviews.author: Karbear

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and does the job, but cheap mounting brackets.
customer_reviews.text: Product looks great and does the job with our thin curtains, but the brackets that hold the rod seem pretty cheap. They didn’t crack or anything, but are very bendy for being made out of metal. If we had heavy curtains I don’t know how well they would hold.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Shy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are nicer than the ones I already have. I bought these to match ones I have in another room. These are sturdy. Came with 3 brackets. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia M.

customer_reviews.title: This product isn't a true white but off-white. To ...
customer_reviews.text: This product isn't a true white but off-white. To make it extra unfortunate, I didn't realize this until after my new place was painted and I got moved in. So while I wish I could return it, I missed my window and am now stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Nellen

customer_reviews.title: Bracket snapped.
customer_reviews.text: The brackets are not made of metal but some kind of clay-like composite that snapped when the professional tried to mount it to the wall. If it didn't break then, it would have when the curtain weight was added to the rod weight. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: WingSpread

product_meta.title: Decopolitan Urn Single Rod Set, 72-144-Inch, Antique Black
product_meta.description: Size:72-144-Inch| Color:Antique BlackUpdate your décor with this elegant, adjustable curtain rod set. Chic urn finials and decorative scroll brackets bring a polished look to any room. 1 inch diameter. Antique black finish. Brackets and mounting hardware included. Coordinates with double rod sets (sold separately) to offer the opportunity to complete multiple windows within the same room. Matching holdbacks available.
feature_bullets: Telescoping range from 72 to 144 inches 1 inch Urn Single Rod Set in Antique Black Finish
Robust Steel Construction and 1" Rod Diameter for Heavier Fabrics
Traditional Antique Black Finish. Perfect for any bedroom, living room, kitchen or bathroom

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,735 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
